Chairperson, it is true what you are saying, but such was the whole counter revolutionary and revolutionary war. Yes, but you did have to evaluate your methods.  You don't have to choose an appropriate level, that's what you've told us.
Yes, but my overhead mission was to disrupt the enemy and the formal bureaucratic processes which could be used, were given to other elements of the State.  I was not to use them, Chairperson.
Did I understand you correctly to say that:   "The enemy did one thing and then we responded, we did another"?

;   Well it was not - do you agree that it was not the proper way of giving them notice that you were on their tail, if you were not going to say that you had done it?

I cannot remember the detail anymore, Mr Chairperson.
